comment.body: Stop Zeronet, Copy your old users.json to your data dir, Start ZeroNet, visit ZeroID site should work.

I'm not really following it, but everyone should use the network that is most suited to his/her needs or he/she likes the best. There is already many alternatives: bittorrent/ipfs/maidsafe/i2p-lafs/etc.
What OS are you using? On windows it should automatically download the latest one from tor's webpage
Yeah, sometimes it decides not to answer, but just did some modification, please try again.
It's possible if there is a LaTeX rendering lib in js.
Can you please send your data/content.db file to hello@zeronet.io ?

@Comeon: ZeroBoard was the first site on ZeroNet when multi-user sites was not possible, so the messages are signed and distributed by contacting the site owner.
I was planning to remove it for a while maybe it's the a good time to do it.

Looks like we got *.zeronet.io domain + 104.156.231.236 ip ban
Any suggestions on solution?
Unfortunately it's not possible if we want unique usernames.
